Articles.Content: Also if you want a shroud that isn't the standard size, for example if you put a 1m engine between 2m parts the auto-shroud would be 1m
cool thanks!!

I have some tall payload and i cant fit into fairing.

Kw rocketry allows only 3 walls and conic top.

How can i edit it to accept 4 walls?
kiwiak: get procedural fairings, the KW ones are nice don't get me wrong, but the procedural ones are a lot more versatile, can make them as big or small as you want/need.

Some times there will be a error loading of model on the fairing base that it shows up in an wrong size(always 1.25m size although it's acturally a 2.5m or3.75m version)when go to launch,especially when use it as the first part of a vessel.

I have a small request. Could the engine sounds be switched to the new FX node system? I'd like to reference KW sounds in my modified engine configs, but the way it's set up, it would require all KW engines to be installed in order to work. With the FX node system, it could be set up so people who need memory could delete the parts and leave only the sounds.

Most marvelous propulsion mod for KSP! Building all working horses for almost all needs.

Thanks for your work!

I wish the shroud on the interstage decouplers could be raised and lowered.

Were overdue for a procedural decoupler mod.
The procedural decoupler mod is called procedural fairings my friend

Encountered some weird thing with 3,75-2,5 m docking port.

http://i.imgur.com/6x9YIRc.png

Obviously, you see what I mean. This is my Mun science\refuel station with all kinds of docking ports. There was a vessel with 2,5m stock port docked to 3.75m port - it was OK. I've undocked it, docked current vessel (3,75m port) - it was OK until I loaded this particular station again.

It's just a visual bug, the port itself is working fine.

//snip//

I'm having this exact issue, except the large docking ring has shrunk on both sides of the connection.

I've seen a few people mention this in this thread, but I must have missed it if this has already been addressed.

Are there plans in the near future to balance the cost of parts? There are more and more mods tracking cost and career mode looks to be introducing cost tracking soon.

Currently all the tanks cost the same amount which is completely out of balance with stock.

It's pretty much certain to be added..

Kyle basic contracts should be coming in .24, so now might be a good time to think about it...

also have you seen the CoolEffects mod? it adds Ice breaking off and boiloff through the engines before launch... could you see about adding it to your engines

Alright I'm lost... how do you get the auto-shrouds to appear? I've tried everything I can think of...

Alright I'm lost... how do you get the auto-shrouds to appear? I've tried everything I can think of...

Did you watch

it may help you?

Alright I'm lost... how do you get the auto-shrouds to appear? I've tried everything I can think of...
Did you watch
it may help you?

I think he's asking for the engine fairings, not the payload fairings. Anyway, you'll just have to place something under an engine to trigger the shrouds, much likethe stock engines.

If you use tweakables (right click) and set the thrust limiter for 50(%) then it will increase the burn time by 200% and decrease the thrust by 50%. You do this by right clicking on the srb in the VAB and then click on the middle of the bar labled thrust limiter. drag it around until the number becomes 50.

Hey Kyle, I was wondering if we could get an update on what you guys are working on for KW? Love the pack btw, will always be my go-to for rockets!

Since you asked nicely. I'm going to be pretty non specific and say that we're working on some bigger things, a couple of small things. There are a few other features that we're also working on that I think people will like, assuming they pan out. I've also been looking at the new effects and the various things I can do with it (or more accurately not do), so we'll see. I'm also at some point going to see what's changed in terms of ram usage for different image formats etc and see if there is any good improvements to be had.

Hopefully that should shed ~some~ light. I'm usually pretty vague about these things, because otherwise I'd just end up being like a trailer that gives away the entire plot of the movie.

You could just say awesomeness will ensue.

That said it does sound like you're working really hard on this, so I guess I'll just leave you to it.

Quick question - is it compatible with career mode? I really like the idea of this mod, but at the same time I really enjoy unlocking parts to play with them.

Do you get everything this mod offers at the beginning, if you play career mode?
I have tried searching the thread and not found an answer. Many of the liquid fueled engines have no sound. Tried redownloading the pack and same issue. What am I missing?

Just how much poorly do textures look using the texture reduction pack? Is it incredibly noticeable, or barely noticeable at all? I'm crashing too often with 40 mods so I think I'm going to give this try. But I haven't seen enough parts to know just how much of a hit I'm taking in the prettiness as that's important to me.
